addons.name: Duplicate Tab Hotkey
addons.description: A Duplicate Tab Hotkey bound to Accel+K.
addons.fullDescription: If enabled, a keyboard shortcut for duplicating the current tab will be bound to Accel+K. Since this conflicts with one of the shortcuts for the Search Bar, an alternate shortcut like Ctrl+J should be used for this purpose.

addons.name: ChatZilla
addons.description: A clean, easy to use and highly extensible Internet Relay Chat (IRC) client.
addons.fullDescription: ChatZilla provides all the usual IRC client features: multiple servers, a built-in list of standard networks, easy searching and sorting of available channels, logging, and DCC chat and file transfers, plus easy customization with JavaScript plug-ins and CSS styling.

screenshots.caption: ChatZilla showing the #chatzilla support channel
ChatZilla's Join Channel dialog

addons.developerComments:
PLEASE, READ THE FAQ FIRST: http://chatzilla.hacksrus.com/faq/

Localised versions: http://chatzilla.hacksrus.com/

addons.name: The Addon Bar (Restored)
addons.description: Gives you a place to put all your add-on buttons without over-crowding the navigation bar.
addons.fullDescription:
Adds back the addon bar for Firefox with the Australis theme (Firefox 29 and up).
It aims to be a lightweight, yet fully functional replacement for the old Addon Bar.
Great for power users who have many addons installed, and especially for long toolbar items.

This also restores the status-bar area, so it works with extensions such as Status-bar Scientific Calculator, Version in Add-on bar, and Forecastfox Weather. Plus, it adds a new feature that lets you move the status-bar around!

Want to help translate? You can do so at BabelZilla.

Have a problem or a feature request? See the support page or the FAQ. Also feel free to send me an email.

:tags:

screenshots.caption: The Addon Bar
Works with light Themes (Personas)
Optional Compact Mode
Fully Customizable

addons.name: Bookmarks Sidebar Button
addons.description: Adds a Bookmarks sidebar button to the Toolbar.
addons.fullDescription:
Adds a Bookmarks sidebar button to the Toolbar Palette and as the first button in the Main Toolbar.
Primarily created for Firefox versions from 29 where there is no separate bookmarks sidebar button.

It becomes useful for me when it requires a relatively longer time to press the Ctrl+B instead of pressing the button with my mouse. E.g. when my left hand is busy or is resting or I just want to use only the mouse instead of typing every time something with the keyboard...

For me I position it as the first toolbar button so that it be closer to the sidebar. But on further updates it may jump to the last position (cause by default the button should have this place (according to this site rules)). So, if that happens, just move it to the place where you had it before.

screenshots.caption: Toolbar is opened and the button is checked
The button is in the Toolbar Palette

addons.name: SQLite Manager
addons.description: Manage any SQLite database on your computer.
addons.fullDescription:
Features:
    Manage any SQLite database on your computer.
    An intuitive heirarchical tree showing database objects.
    Helpful dialogs to manage tables, indexes, views and triggers.
    You can browse and search the tables, as well as add, edit, delete and duplicate the records.
    Facility to execute any sql query.
    The views can be searched too.
    A dropdown menu helps with the sql syntax thus making writing sql easier.
    Easy access to common operations through menu, toolbars, buttons and context-menu.
    Export tables/views/database in csv/xml/sql format. Import from csv/xml/sql (both UTF-8 and UTF-16).
    Possible to execute multiple sql statements in Execute tab.
    You can save the queries.
    Support for ADS on Windows.

screenshots.caption: Main screen
Main window
Create a Table
Search

addons.developerComments:
The source code and various scripts used in this project are hosted as a git repository at https://github.com/lazierthanthou/sqlite-manager.

The following command will create a clone of the project in your current directory:
git clone git://github.com/lazierthanthou/sqlite-manager.git

In case you would like to download the source without having to clone the repository,

    you can download the tarball
    or, you can download the zip

addons.name: colorPicker
addons.description: A very simple extension for learning web page colors. Copy the RGB or Hex color code of any pixel displayed in your browser to the clipboard (in CSS/HTML format). Similar in function to Internet Explorer's color picker.
addons.fullDescription: Very simple and similar in function to Internet Explorer's color picker. Useful for finding the exact color code (RGB or Hex) of any pixel displayed on any webpage. Click on the colorPicker icon and then place your mouse over any pixel in the browser. The panel will display the color of the pixel currently under the mouse icon as well as both the RGB and Hex code of that color. Press escape to copy the CSS and HTML ready RGB or Hex code to your clipboard (select which type from the panel). There is no trust required like other complicated color tools - the source is all javascript and simple to read!

screenshots.caption: Simple and effective.

addons.name: DownThemAll!
addons.description: The first and only download manager/accelerator built inside Firefox!
addons.fullDescription:
DownThemAll is all you can desire from a download manager: it features an advanced accelerator that increases speed up to 4x and it allows you to pause and resume downloads at any time.

DownThemAll is fast, reliable and easy-to-use! It lets you download all the links or images contained in a webpage and much more: you can refine your downloads by fully customizable criteria to get only what you really want! Be in full control over your downloads, dedicated speed and number of parallel connections at any time. Use Metalinks or add mirrors manually to download a file from different servers at the same time.

DownThemAll is open-source and freeware. No Adware, no Spyware, no hidden costs!

For more information see our Features page.

DownThemAll! 3.0 Beta versions are available from downthemall.net. We urge people willing to help out with testing to have a look. Please note that these preview versions on our homepage were NOT reviewed by mozilla yet.

screenshots.caption: Selection window (Windows)
Manager window (Mac OS X)
Adding new Downloads (Ubuntu)
Toolbar buttons (Windows)

addons.developerComments:
DownThemAll! 3.0 Beta versions are available from downthemall.net. We urge people willing to help out with testing to have a look. Please note that these preview versions on our homepage were NOT reviewed by mozilla yet.

IMPORTANT! You're strongly encouraged to post any problem you may be experiencing at our bug tracker!
Thanks for your great support!
We, in general, do not monitor discussions taking place here or at other popular forums. There is simply no time for that.

All releases are also available from: https://code.downthemall.net/releases/
It is however encouraged to use the version published here on Mozilla Add-Ons.

DownThemAll! in your language: You can help making available DownThemAll! in your language, or improving existing translations. For more information about how to get involved, please see: DownThemAll! 2.0 translation started.

addons.name: Regex Find
addons.description: Adds Regular expressions functionality to the findbar
addons.fullDescription:
Adds a Regex checkbox to the findbar in Firefox 25 to 35.
This allows to search on page using regular expressions.

The addon offers basic regex search functionality except:
- some control symbols - \f, \n, \r, \v
- doesn't search in the following tags: input, textarea, frame, select, img, canvas, svg
- doesn't search in hidden blocks after they are showed

Also added some shortcuts:
- Ctrl+F toggles the findbar
- F2/F3 searches backwards/forward

screenshots.caption: Positive lookahead (search 'javascript' but select 'java')
Match case
Highlight first word in each line

addons.name: Web Developer
addons.description: The Web Developer extension adds various web developer tools to the browser.
addons.fullDescription: The Web Developer extension adds various web developer tools to the browser.

screenshots.caption: The Web Developer toolbar

addons.developerComments:
The best place for support is not in the reviews section below, but on the Web Developer site:

http://chrispederick.com/work/web-developer/firefox/help/

addons.name: Downloads Window
addons.description: This restartless extension provides a separate downloads window.
addons.fullDescription: Downloads Window replacing the "Downloads" menu items and key accelerators to instead create a pre-Firefox 26 browser.download.useToolkitUI-style separate downloads window.

addons.name: Close Other Tabs Shortcuts
addons.description: Adds keyboard shortcuts to close other tabs and tabs to the right
addons.fullDescription:
This addon adds the following keyboard shortcuts:
- Close Other (Alt-W) - closes other tabs except the current one.
- Close Right (Ctrl-Alt-W) - closes all tabs to the right of the current one.

The commands were taken from the tab context menu.
The addon replaces my previously submitted Close Other Tabs Menu addon.

addons.name: View Source Chart
addons.description: Inspect the DOM at lightning speed.
addons.fullDescription:
1. Provides the maximum amount of information in the current view port.

2. Allows for accelerated human processing of said info.

3. Cure-all for the pitfalls of indentation.

Cross-browser bookmarklet and About Info at http://viewsourcechart.com. Check it out. Really.

screenshots.caption: Right-click on a page >> Select View Source Chart
See the yellow span tag container? The number of ancestors it has and even their tag names are clear in this visualization.

How many ancestors does the innermost element have?
What are the ancestors' tag names?
Default source view in browser using syntax coloring. Syntax coloring is helpful, but does nothing to convey document structure.

addons.developerComments:
* Right-Click on a web page and choose "View Source Chart"
* To view a frameset document, select "View Source Chart" from the Fx View menu.
* To open charts in a TAB, see View Source Chart Options.
* To Collapse a code container, click any hot area indicated by a pointer style cursor.
* To Expand, click anywhere in the collapsed container.
* To see a container's opening tag with attributes, hover your mouse over the container.

ZOOM FEATURE
To zoom out of charts, decrease font size (Ctrl + -). This is helpful when viewing deeply nested, complex source.
************************************

Source Charts are based on the post-rendered source returned by the browser, the same source you see when selecting "View Selection Source" (CTRL + A then right click).
************************************
Localization support was added by Jean-Bernard Marcon.
Jean-Bernard also ported View Source Chart 2.7 to function with KompoZer, a classy and highly functional complete Web Authoring System.

addons.name: Bookmark Shortcuts
addons.description: Adds shortcuts to Bookmark Toolbar
addons.fullDescription:
This addon adds shortcuts for bookmarks in the Bookmarks Toolbar:
    - Alt+1..9 to open first 9 bookmarks in the same tab
    - Alt+0 opens the 10th bookmark
    - Ctrl+OS+1..9, 0 to open first 10 bookmarks in a new tab

These are default shortcuts. It is also possible to change default modifiers (control keys) to open bookmarks in the same tab or in the new tab. The options window lets choose between the following keys:
    - Alt
    - Control (for Linux OS)
    - OS key - Win key in Windows
    - Control + Alt
    - Command + Alt (for Mac OS)
    - Control + OS
    - Alt + OS

Main addon features:
    - allows to open bookmarks with visible or hidden Bookmarks Toolbar
    - when bookmarks position is changed opens bookmarks from the correct positions
    - skips folders and counts only links

addons.name: Adblock Plus
addons.description:
Blocks annoying video ads on YouTube, Facebook ads, banners and much more.

Adblock Plus blocks all annoying ads, and supports websites by not blocking unobtrusive ads by default (configurable).
addons.fullDescription:
Adblock Plus allows you to regain control of the internet and view the web the way you want to. The add-on is supported by over forty filter subscriptions in dozens of languages which automatically configure it for purposes ranging from removing online advertising to blocking all known malware domains. Adblock Plus also allows you to customize your filters with the assistance of a variety of useful features, including a context option for images, a block tab for Flash and Java objects, and a list of blockable items to remove scripts and stylesheets.

Starting with Adblock Plus 2.0 there is an option in Filter Preferences to allow some non-intrusive advertising. The goal is to support websites using non-intrusive ways to advertise and to encourage more websites to do the same. Read more

screenshots.caption: Easily remove all annoying ads from Firefox.
Adblock Plus can do more than adblocking. Enable powerful features in one click.
Clean up your Facebook experience with Adblock Plus.
Adblock Plus even removes those annoying 30-second video ads on YouTube.
Remove all annoying blinking banners!
Browse the web as it once used to be.
Please help us by reporting bugs.
You can even create your own blocking lists to customize the web to your exact needs.

addons.name: Firesizer
addons.description:
Allows you to resize the window to specific dimensions.

NOTE: Users of Firefox 29 and above must install "The Addon Bar" extension to use this, as Firesizer uses the add-on bar that has been removed in Firefox 29.
addons.fullDescription:
Provides a menu and status bar to resize the window dimensions to a specific size. Unlike other similar extensions, this one sets the size of the *entire window*, not just the HTML area, which better reflects the environment that end users will be using.

This add-on uses the "Add On" bar at the bottom of the Firefox window, which is hidden by default on recent versions of Firefox. I highly recommend the Barlesque add-on to get the best of both worlds.

Heavily inspired by "Yet Another Window Resizer" by Galoca

FAQ:

    Why doesn't Firesizer resize only the HTML area (viewport)?
    This extension is meant to resize the entire browser window to the specified size, not only the HTML viewport. I really feel that most, if not all web site designs seem to target some sort of ideal viewport size (like 1024x768), and always seem to forget about window borders, scroll bars, etc..., and it really drives me nuts. You can't ignore the fact that browsers have all of these interface elements. If you're developing for mobile devices, this is a different story, and in that case, using the viewport size would make more sense (but Firesizer doesn't support that mode).
    Why are the measurements incorrect (such as when the window is maximized)?
    Firesizer's measurements include window borders, top/bottom status bars, menus, navigation buttons, etc... When these are included, the measurements are accurate.

    Further, when the window is maximized, Windows actually just makes the window so big that you can't see the borders, but they're still there. This will cause the measurements to appear to be inaccurate in a maximized window. There is no way to account for this in the extension because the border widths are OS specific, and users can change them if they want.
    Why doesn't Firesizer work in Firefox 29 and higher?
    Firefox 29 and above users will also need to install The Addon Bar extension to use Firesizer, which relies on the status bar to display the current resolution.

addons.name: Element Inspector
addons.description: Shift-RightClick any element to open it in DOM Inspector.

addons.name: YouTube ALL HTML5
addons.description: Play all videos on youtube without flash in your preferred size using only HTML5.
addons.fullDescription:
A new alpha version with support for MSE is available in the Development Channel (see bottom of the page).


With this addon you can play almost any video on YouTube without Flash as a HTML5 video. This includes videos with monetarisation enabled which normally don't play in the html5 player.

With standard settings, videos are automatically loaded in the HTML5 player.

Features

    Select different methods to force the HTML5 player
    Change the size and/or the quality (independently) of the video (manually or automatically)
    Disable Flash only on YouTube (experimental feature which does not always work properly!)
    Disable the YouTube SPF function (active by default)
    Workaround for the volume bug


Current problems

    Only 360p and 720p are supported in the HTML5 player with firefox, because the MSE are not yet supported fully.
    If you have problems under Linux or MacOS, please see Developer’s Comments at the end of this site.
    Some live-streams and copy protected videos can not be viewed

screenshots.caption: Simply click the button...
...and enjoy videos in HTML5!
Addon settings (in the Addon Manager)

addons.developerComments:
Some videos on YouTube (most 720p ones) are only available as MP4/H264. However this codec is not uniformly supported:

    Windows XP: H264 is not supported and will not be
    Windows Vista+: H264 is fully supported since firefox 22
    Linux: Supported since firefox 26 using gstreamer (you need to install gstreamer0.10-plugins-good and gstreamer0.10-ffmpeg and have so set media.gstreamer.enabled to true in about:config)
    MacOS: H264 is not yet supported

You can test if your firefox supports H264 on this site: https://www.youtube.com/html5

addons.name: DOM Inspector
addons.description: DOM Inspector is a tool that can be used to inspect and edit the live DOM of any web document or XUL application. The DOM can be navigated using a two-paned window displaying a variety of different views on the document and all nodes within.
addons.fullDescription:
Inspects the structure and properties of a window and its contents with a variety of views.

All contributions for this add-on go to the Mozilla Foundation. Mozilla promotes openness, innovation and participation on the Internet. Learn more at www.mozilla.org/foundation.

Extensions that extend the DOM Inspector:

    InspectorWidget
    Element Inspector
    Stacked Inspector

screenshots.caption: Several methods to choose a document to inspect.
Inspect content documents loaded in browser tabs or in a mail message pane.
Inspect Mozilla chrome as well. (A Mozilla application's interface, including widgets like buttons, tabs, and menus, comprise the "chrome".)
Edit the attributes on chrome nodes to alter elements and behavior of the interface as you're running the application.
Search for a specific node in the document with a few different methods.
Examine and modify the style rules that affect the style of content or chrome elements.
Use DOM Inspector viewers to look at different aspects of the document from various perspectives.
Change the viewer to look at different aspects of a given node from various perspectives.

addons.developerComments: DOM Inspector is a mozilla.org project. File reports for bugs, feature requests, and translation updates on bugzilla.mozilla.org (Product: Other Applications, Component: DOM Inspector). Contact Neil Rashbrook, #seamonkey on irc.mozilla.org, or anyone in the Mozilla community for help contributing to the DOM Inspector.

addons.name: Password Exporter
addons.description: This extension allows you to export your saved passwords and disabled login hosts using XML or CSV files that can be imported later.
addons.fullDescription:
After installation, you can export and import your passwords from the following locations:

    Options/Preferences -> Security pane -> Passwords -> Import/Export Passwords button

    Tools -> Add-ons -> Extensions tab -> click Preferences button next to the extension


NOTICE: An optional obfuscation feature is provided that makes the exported files hard for humans to read, and is mainly to prevent casual users from stumbling upon your passwords. It will in no way stop someone who actually wants to see them, as they could just import your file anyway. Better encryption will be added in the future.

screenshots.caption: Completed import
Import in progress

addons.developerComments:
Please see http://passwordexporter.fligtar.com for support, enhancement requests, and bug reports. Thanks!

The latest version that supports Firefox 1.5 is 1.0.6. The latest version that supports Firefox 2 and Thunderbird 2 is 1.2.

addons.name: No Close Buttons
addons.description: In Firefox 31, the browser.tabs.closeButtons option was removed. This addon forces what previously used to be a value of 2 for that option: no close buttons on any tabs.
addons.fullDescription: Feedback is welcome on GitHub

addons.name: Duplicate This Tab
addons.description: This add-on provides the much needed feature update of Tab Duplication to Mozilla Browsers. Features Supported include Duplication of Browser Tabs, Detaching Tabs and Merging All Windows.
addons.fullDescription:
This addon is NO longer under active development. If you wish to maintain it, please contact
quickemail.007@gmail.com along with details of relevant development/support experience and/or interest!

Whenever a need to have two or more copies of a tab (for many reasons...), detach an existing tab (and place it in a separate window) or want to merge two firefox windows, you'll find this addon to be of great use.

This add-on is a port of the popular Duplicate Tab add-on, which is no longer supported by that add-on's developer.

Happy Browsing and Tabbing!

screenshots.caption:
You can also duplicate the tab in a new window.
.... (and then merge it back with the previous window!!!)
Choose Menu Option to Duplicate Tab  by right clicking on the desired tab.
The desired tab now has a duplicate tab!!!

addons.name: MeasureIt
addons.description: Draw a ruler across any webpage to check the width, height, or alignment of page elements in pixels.
addons.fullDescription: Draw a ruler across any webpage to check the width, height, or alignment of page elements in pixels.

screenshots.caption: MeasureIt screenshot

addons.name: ColorZilla
addons.description: Advanced Eyedropper, Color Picker, Gradient Generator and other colorful goodies...
addons.fullDescription:
Advanced Eyedropper, Color Picker, Gradient Generator and other colorful goodies.

With ColorZilla you can get a color reading from any point in your browser, quickly adjust this color and paste it into another program. You can Zoom the page you are viewing and measure distances between any two points on the page. The built-in palette browser allows choosing colors from pre-defined color sets and saving the most used colors in custom palettes. DOM spying features allow getting various information about DOM elements quickly and easily. The powerful CSS gradient generator allows quick and easy creation of beautiful gradients. And there's more...

You can always find the latest version at http://colorzilla.com/
